title: Setup - Ubuntu/Debian
description: Deploy Microsoft Defender for Endpoint on Linux: Ubuntu

userActivity.Value: This exercie assumes you have a Linux VM setup and running Ubuntu.

data.title: Envrionment Setup
data.description: Get the environment ready for MDE for Linux on Ubuntu

userActivity.Value: Install curl if it isn't installed yet

Curl  is  a  tool  to  transfer data from or to a server, using one of the supported protocols (DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS,  LDAP,  LDAPS,  POP3,  POP3S,  RTMP, RTSP,  SCP,  SFTP,  SMB,  SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET and TFTP). The command is designed to work without user interaction.
Install libplist-utils if it isn't installed yet
This package contains tools to convert Apple property list files from binary to XML and vice-versa.
Each Linux distrobution has a different package manager. For example, Ubuntu uses apt-get, while SUSE uses zypper.

userActivity.Value: Install the Microsoft GPG public key

GPG is a public key encryption system. The above command will download the Microsoft public key and add it to the system. GnuPG allows you to encrypt and sign your data and communications https://gnupg.org/

backgroundActivity.Value:
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree
Reading state information... Done
gpg is already the newest version (2.2.19-3ubuntu2.2).
gpg set to manually installed.
0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
Sample output - Microsoft GPG public key
On success, the above command will return no output.
curl is downloading the Microsoft GPG public key from https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc
We pipe the output to gpg. gpg then decrypts the file
We pipe the output to tee. tee then writes the output to the file /etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d/microsoft.gpg

userActivity.Value: Install the HTTPS driver if not already installed

This APT transport allows the use of repositories accessed via the HTTP Secure protocol (HTTPS), also referred to as HTTP over TLS. It is available by default since apt 1.5 and was available before that in the package apt-transport-https.

userActivity.Value: apt-get update is used to resynchronize the package index files from their sources. The indexes of available packages are fetched from the location(s) specified in /etc/apt/sources.list. For example, when using a Debian archive, this command retrieves and scans the Packages.gz files, so that information about new and updated packages is available. An update should always be performed before an upgrade or dist-upgrade.

data.title: Explore the MDATP application
data.description: Let's check the configuration of the MDE for Linux agent

userActivity.Value: The 'mdatp health' command will show the health of the MDE for Linux agent. This will show if the agent is healthy, if there are any health issues, if the agent is licensed, and configurations values.

In this case we can see a licensing error. We need to run the onboarding script to register the agent with the MDATP service.

userActivity.Value: Make sure you have the correct permissions and licenses. You will need to be a Global Administrator or Security Administrator to access this page.
Then Select Linux Server from the drop list of operating systems.

tasks.title: Optional - Copy the onboarding script to the Linux server

userActivity.Value: Optional - Copy the onboarding script to the Linux server
If you are running Windows with Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) you can copy the onboarding script to the Linux server using the following command.
The above command is using a certificate to authenitcate to the Linux server. You can also use a username and password.
The file copied is stored in the home directory of the user you are authenticating as.
Install unzip if not already installed.
From the folder where you have copied the onboarding script.
